Notes: 4.5-gen with KLJ-7A AESA radar (170 km detection), fly-by-wire, and 6-8 PL-15E missiles for agile BVR; integrates with ZDK-03/Erieye via datalinks for 150+ km networked shots; 20 operational (16 more on order), forming 2 squadrons at Kamra for high-threat intercepts.

Upgraded AESA (KLJ-7A, 160 km range), 6 PL-15/PL-12 pylons, and composite airframe for sustained BVR; all prior blocks (156 total fleet) upgrading to Block 3 std. by 2026; core of PAF (10+ squadrons), enabling lofted launches with AEW cueing to 150 km envelope.

Advanced variant with AN/APG-68(V)9 radar (120 km), 6 AIM-120C-5 loads, and HARM for SEAD-BVR; No. 5 Sqn at Minhas; sustains hybrid ops with JF-17, integrated via Link-16 for US-allied exercises extending to 110 km effective range.

Two-seat with identical AN/APG-68(V)9 and 4-6 AIM-120C-5 missiles for tactics/BVR missions; supports squadron lead and ELINT fusion; bridges to J-10CE, with datalink compatibility for Sino-US hybrid targeting.

Mid-life upgraded with AN/APG-68(V)5 (100 km) and AIM-120C-5 for cost-effective BVR filler; No. 9/11 Sqns at Sargodha; 75 total F-16 fleet (incl. 23 F-16BM MLU trainers), vital for volume despite sanctions on spares.

AESA radar (350 km horizon) for off-board targeting and mid-course PL-15/AIM-120 updates; 9 operational (1 lost 2012); No. 24 Sqn at Kamra, critical enabler for JF-17/J-10 salvos in 150 km envelopes via indigenous datalinks.

Re-roled EW/ESM/ECM platform (2024) with 400 km sensors for radar jamming and cueing; supports BVR by degrading enemy IADS; fleet reassigned from AEW, enhancing hybrid Sino-Pak networks for 140 km effective range.

Dual-role tanker/transporter with probe refueling for 2+ hour BVR extensions on F-16/JF-17; ex-Ukrainian, operational at Nur Khan; enables sustained patrols despite limited numbers, integrated with Erieye for persistent ops.
